So I've been told, though never properly tested, that if you pour some water in a 2 liter then also put the mixture in it and fully seal the bottle, the bottle will then expand from the heat and pressure and if placed by a fire when it explodes, it is capable of making a pretty big fireball/explosion.

I have also been told though never tested at all, that you can take the match heads off the matches in the package and cram them in a clean tobasco sauce bottle from the mre, once in the bottle you cut a small hole in the lid and put a full match in it with the head in the bottle, so that you can then light the matchstick end and have a tiny explosive... obviously dangerous and could throw glass everywhere... but you guys have done some crazy stuff with glass bottles so have fun.

Also an idea, take the heater pack and place the element in a glass bottle then place some water in it and seal it with something... or use it as the ignition source for a potato gun... I think there are lots of things you can do with them that have not been fully realized

Hearing the temperature that the MRE's are warmed to gives me a big ol' YIKES!. It's smack in the middle of the Temperature Danger Zone (41F to 135F), which is the prime temperature for bacterial growth. Bacterial growth does also include viral growth as most viruses are just a fast growing bacteria. This could probably cause issues in third-world countries that have foreign diseases and are too poor for treatment, as if the MRE's are in that temp then the bacteria will grow. Unless the food on the inside is vacuum sealed, this could be a big reason on why military people get sick.
